INDICATOR_NAME: Adjusted savings: mineral depletion (% of GNI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Mineral depletion is the ratio of the value of the stock of mineral resources to the remaining reserve lifetime. It covers tin, gold, lead, zinc, iron, copper, nickel, silver, bauxite, and phosphate.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank staff estimates based on sources and methods described in the World Bank's The Changing Wealth of Nations.
